SENT.plain: A medication error resulted in two kittens being treated with azathioprine (12 and 12.5 mg/kg) instead of azithromycin for 2 weeks
On clinical examination, the kittens were febrile, weak, and had oronasal hemorrhage
Complete blood cell counts indicated severe bone marrow suppression
Treatment consisted of multiple transfusions, antibiotics, and granulocyte colony-stimulating factor
One of the kittens responded to therapy and had a complete recovery
The other kitten was treated for 40 days with no clinical response before dying
Both kittens also contracted Mycoplasma hemofelis infection from a contaminated blood transfusion
